Articles.Content: All my ships keep rolling left! I can't stop it and SAS doesn't help. I tested and it is not craft design. A perfectly alligned craft (e.g command mod parachuting) still does this! It is now affecting every single ship I launch. My last 7 launches in a row have busted from it! I removed all my mods and it is still there! ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif) Help! I run windows 64x! I think I'll revert it to 0.25 for the time being. This is if you go away bug: ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

> 
> All my ships keep rolling left! I can't stop it and SAS doesn't help. I tested and it is not craft design. A perfectly alligned craft (e.g command mod parachuting) still does this! It is now affecting every single ship I launch. My last 7 launches in a row have busted from it! I removed all my mods and it is still there! ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif) Help! I run windows 64x! I think I'll revert it to 0.25 for the time being. This is if you go away bug: ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Can we have your log files please? And also are you running the x64 build of KSP or are you on Windows 64-bit?

[Here'](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92229-How-To-Get-Support-%28READ-FIRST%29)s how to find your player logs.

> 
> Can we have your log files please? And also are you running the x64 build of KSP or are you on Windows 64-bit?
> [Here'](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92229-How-To-Get-Support-%28READ-FIRST%29)s how to find your player logs.

I'm on a 64 bit computer. I think KSP is 32 bit. 

P.S The link does not give me any useful info.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-01T01:58:12Z" title="03/01/2015 01:58  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 1, 2015</time> by CrazyJebGuy**

> 
> I'm on a 64 bit computer. I think KSP is 32 bit.

Gib logs plox.

There's not much that can be done without them, especially about the problems of the sort you're describing.

> 
> Gib logs plox.
> There's not much that can be done without them, especially about the problems of the sort you're describing.

The info on that oage was useless. I'd already read it anyhow. My prob is simple: Craft want to rotate left, SAS fails. I can still make it rotate, but it always goes back to rotating left.

You might want to read it (and DuoDex's posts) again. DuoDex asked to see a copy of your output\_log.txt (Windows) / Player.log (Mac, Linux). The location differs depending on your system, but it contains a lot of information about what goes wrong with KSP. It would also tell us if there are any remnants of mods that got accidental left in when you cleaned them out.

Another way of putting it: we don't like to guess at problems. Give us good information to help us narrow it down.

> 
> You might want to read it (and DuoDex's posts) again. DuoDex asked to see a copy of your output\_log.txt (Windows) / Player.log (Mac, Linux). The location differs depending on your system, but it contains a lot of information about what goes wrong with KSP. It would also tell us if there are any remnants of mods that got accidental left in when you cleaned them out.
> Another way of putting it: we don't like to guess at problems. Give us good information to help us narrow it down.

But I can't find it.

> 
> But I can't find it.

In that case we really can't help you.

Sorry.
